question: How did the AMD Data Center segment perform in Q3 2024?
ground_truth: The Data Center segment revenue reached a record $3.5 billion in Q3 2024, up 122% year-over-year, driven by strong sales of AMD Instinct GPUs and EPYC CPUs.
generated_answer:
Atomic Facts with Citations:
• AMD Data Center had a very strong quarter overall in Q3 2024, especially for the Instinct product portfolio [C1][C4]
• AMD completed important customer milestones and ramped above initial expectations in Q3 [C4]
• Data Center GPU revenue was very strong in Q3, approaching the size of the compute business which was around $1.7 billion [C5]
• September actuals for Data Center GPU were in the $1.5 billion range [C3]
• AMD raised full-year Data Center GPU guidance from exceeding $4.5 billion to exceeding $5 billion based on completion of customer milestones [C4]
• The guidance increase was driven by a $500 million raise in the 2024 outlook [C8]
 Final Answer:
AMD's Data Center segment delivered exceptional performance in Q3 2024. Data Center GPU revenue approached $1.5 billion [C3], matching the size of AMD's compute business at around $1.7 billion [C5]. The segment significantly outperformed expectations, with AMD completing important customer milestones and ramping above initial projections [C4].
Based on this strong performance, AMD raised its full-year Data Center GPU guidance by $500 million, from exceeding $4.5 billion to exceeding $5 billion [C4][C8]. The Instinct product portfolio was particularly strong, driving the overall Data Center segment's robust results [C1][C4].
The company demonstrated strong execution in supply chain management and customer delivery, positioning well for continued growth trajectory through year-end [C4].
